description: As a result of Curtiss Monroe and MCS' commitment to the retail community, a complete set of OPOS control objects have been developed for public use.  These are referred to as the "Common Control Objects."
displayName: OLE Retail POS (OPOS) Common Control Object
summary: OLE for Retail POS consists of: 1. An architecture for Win32-based POS device access. 2. A set of POS device interfaces sufficient to support a wide range of POS solutions. Release 1.6 includeed 21 device classes.
author: Curtis Monroe
